title: Genetics & Heredity Practice Exam
description: Test your understanding of genetic inheritance and DNA structure

questions.question: In pea plants, tall (T) is dominant over short (t). If a heterozygous tall plant (Tt) is crossed with a short plant (tt), what percentage of offspring will be tall?
questions.explanation: The cross Tt × tt produces: Tt, Tt, tt, tt. Two out of four (50%) will be tall (Tt).

questions.question: A dominant allele is always more common in a population than a recessive allele.
questions.explanation: Dominance refers to how alleles are expressed in phenotype, not their frequency in a population. Recessive alleles can be more common.

questions.question: Which DNA base pairs with Adenine (A)?
questions.explanation: In DNA, Adenine (A) always pairs with Thymine (T), and Guanine (G) pairs with Cytosine (C).

questions.question: An organism with two identical alleles for a trait (such as TT or tt) is called _______.
questions.explanation: Homozygous means having two identical alleles. Heterozygous means having two different alleles.

questions.question: Two heterozygous plants for purple flowers (Pp) are crossed. What is the expected phenotypic ratio of the offspring?
questions.explanation: Pp × Pp produces PP, Pp, Pp, pp. Three show purple phenotype (PP and Pp) and one shows white (pp), giving a 3:1 ratio.

questions.question: Genotype refers to the physical appearance of an organism.
questions.explanation: Genotype refers to the genetic makeup (alleles present). Phenotype refers to the physical appearance or observable traits.

questions.question: If the DNA sequence on one strand is 5'-GCTA-3', what is the complementary strand?
questions.explanation: Using base pairing (G-C, C-G, T-A, A-T): G pairs with C, C with G, T with A, A with T. The complementary strand runs antiparallel: 3'-CGAT-5'.

questions.question: A heterozygous black cat (Bb) is crossed with a homozygous white cat (bb). What is the probability that a kitten will be white?
questions.explanation: The cross Bb × bb produces Bb, Bb, bb, bb. Two out of four (50%) are white (bb).
